edge: Kaal is a 2005 Indian Hindi-language supernatural horror film written and directed by Soham Shah.
Soham Shah is the writer and director of Kaal (film).
Kaal (film) was jointly produced by Karan Johar and Shah Rukh Khan.
Shah Rukh Khan jointly produced Kaal (film) with Karan Johar.
Ajay Devgn is one of the actors in Kaal (film).
John Abraham is one of the actors in Kaal (film).
Vivek Oberoi is one of the actors in Kaal (film).
Esha Deol is one of the actors in Kaal (film).
Lara Dutta is one of the actors in Kaal (film).
The story of Kaal (film) focuses on a wildlife expert.
The story of Kaal (film) takes place in the fictional Orbit National Park, which alludes to the world-famous Jim Corbett National Park, Nainital, Uttarakhand.
The story of Kaal (film) involves a mysterious tour guide who helps the characters battle against a mysterious entity for their lives.
The story of Kaal (film) begins with the deaths of two British nationals in Corbett National Park due to a ferocious tiger.
The story of Kaal (film) is followed by several other tiger attacks and many deaths result, prompting National Geographic to send a correspondent to the national park.
National Geographic sends a correspondent, Krish Thapar, to Corbett National Park in the story of Kaal (film).
Krish Thapar is sent by National Geographic to Corbett National Park in the story of Kaal (film).
Krish Thapar is accompanied by his wife Riya in the story of Kaal (film).
Dev Malhotra is one of the characters in Kaal (film) who goes on a hunting trip.
Dev Malhotra's girlfriend Ishika accompanies him on his hunting trip in Kaal (film).
One of the characters in Kaal (film) who goes on a hunting trip is named Sajid.
Another character in Kaal (film) who goes on a hunting trip is named Vishal.
An alcoholic passerby driver named Bagga gives the two groups a lift in Kaal (film).
The fictional Orbit National Park, where most of the story of Kaal (film) takes place, alludes to Corbett National Park.
The world-famous Jim Corbett National Park is located in Nainital, Uttarakhand and is referenced in the story of Kaal (film).
The group encounters three tigers on their way out of the jungle.
Sajid goes missing while in the core area for hunting.
The group stays at DS Pandey's guesthouse and he agrees to lead them to the core area for hunting.
DS Pandey leads the group to the core area for hunting.
Bashir Khan warns the group about the recent deaths in the jungle.
Krish starts to get suspicious about the real cause of DS Pandey's death in the jungle as he is an animal expert.
Bagga finds the group a guesthouse to stay owned by DS Pandey.
The road is blocked by rocks due to the landslide caused by rain.
Kaali shows up again and agrees to lead the group out of the jungle.
Kaali appears to be very knowledgeable about the jungle and its history.
Krish, who is now more curious about the mysterious deaths,
Kaali tells them a story about a crazy tour guide in this jungle,
who used to lead tourists to the wrong places just to have them killed by wild animals.
later caught him and beat him to death but his ghost remains in the jungle and continues to kill tourists.
Bagga later disappears while repairing his car,
Vishal is decapitated shortly thereafter when a window of their car flies and hits him due to the explosion.
Riya wakes up thirsty in the night. She decides to get water from the well despite Kaali's warning,
and is later accidentally hung by her foot in the well and dies.

Kaali's anger and hatred for tourists who come to the jungle to hunt wild animals and disrupt their well being without any regrets. This is the sole reason why he misleads tourists before killing them.
The trio's decision to escape the jungle once and for all after realizing that Kaali is a ghost and is responsible for all the mysterious deaths happening in the jungle.
The remaining group members figure out that Riya is dead and try to pull her body out from the well.
The villagers did not kill Kaali but instead, took him to the core area where he was brutally thrashed and then thrown in front of a hungry tiger that mauled him to death.

The story Kaali told them earlier is true and that Kaali himself is in the ghost of the tour guide mentioned in the story because the villagers did not kill him but instead, took him to the core area where he was brutally thrashed and then thrown in front of a hungry tiger that mauled him to death.

Dev checks all the videos which had been recorded by Vishal and notices that Kaali is not visible in any of them.
relationship between the deaths in the jungle and Krish's report, where he attributes the deaths to tiger attacks rather than revealing the true cause
attempts on their lives on their way out of the jungle, apparently arranged by Kaali
driving Krish, Dev, and Ishika away from the jungle on the road
Krish's decision not to disclose the real cause of deaths in the jungle to anyone since no one will believe him
encounters a new group of tourists in the jungle
Kaali has one of the members killed by a truck in the jungle
assisted Karan Johar in Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham...
Scenes involving tigers were shot in Bangkok, where they used to roam free on sets
Vivek Oberoi wanted to portray the character Kaali, but later accepted the role he was offered
The film was shot at the Jim Corbett National Park
The film received mixed reviews from critics...
...noting it to be a different type of horror film received mixed reviews from critics.
Planet Bollywood rated the film 5/10, stating,' Soham Shah is as inept at directing performances as he is at writing an engaging screenplay or building any sort of momentum or pacing visually.'
Lack of strong characterization tells on the dismal level of performances from the cast.
Lara Dutta cringes, cries, and yells randomly,
...consistently carries a strange expression on her face that suggests she might have just swallowed a frog.
Capable actors, Vivek Oberoi and John Abraham are sadly curtailed by their cardboard characters.
